actions.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

official_title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that the President should work with the participants at the San Antonio Summit toward stopping the trade in illicit drugs.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that the President should build upon the success of the Cartagena Summit and use the upcoming San Antonio Summit to: (1) reaffirm the mutual commitment of the participating countries to halting the international cocaine trade; (2) continue assisting the Andean Strategy nations in their efforts to curtail cocaine production; (3) encourage cooperation among the participating countries in dismantling drug trafficking cartels and arresting and incarcerating major traffickers; (4) strengthen the legitimate economies of the Andean Strategy nations through trade incentives and other assistance; and (5) motivate the participating countries to reduce consumption of illicit drugs within their borders.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that the President should work with the participants at the San Antonio Summit toward stopping the trade in illicit drugs.
